Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones Lodging”
Reviews.Author: llvcentralmass
Reviews.Content: Convienent Upper West Side location to Central Park, Columbia University, eclectic dining and public transportation. Other than that, rooms are extremely small with bare bones furnishings ----- definitely a no frills place. Room and bathroom were clean, although bathroom could use some refurbishing. Staff not overly friendly. For $155 and a one night stay it was tolerable. The hotel advertises recent updates, yet I think this applies only to the new lobby doors (which, by the way, open opposite to what one expects; push to get in and pull to go out; I thought all egress doors had to open outward, not inward, but perhaps NYC has different regulations). Doubt that I will ever book or recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: wanderer2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fine. It's in a great location near Central Park and near some nice little restaurants and easy access to the subway. It was expensive for wht we got, but thats understandable as it was late december right before new year. Plus hotels and hostels are generally quite expensive in NYC. We were given a free upgrade, which was nice as we werent exepecting a private bathroom. Only downside was a noisy heating pipe in our room, but we just used earplugs to sleep and the pipe helped us dry our washing! I would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost, good experience”
Reviews.Author: Brazilian_walker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Morningside Inn during 2011-2012 Christmastime and New Year’s Eve. We chose it due to PRICE x LOCALIZATION combination. The neighborhood was quiet and safe, just 3 blocks to subway station. The room was very clean and comfortable, no cigar smoke smell in any place; 32 inches TV with many channels; good bed (no bed bugs); friendly staff (especially Patrick and Denise); Good bathroom and very good daily cleaning service. The only bad point was the wireless LAN that does not reach the upstairs rooms and all guests had to stay at the first floor for connecting their laptops/tablets to Internet.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Claudia P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Morningside Inn during Christmas time. Of course the rates are higher in this season, but the manager (Patrick) was kind enough to make some arrangements for me to stay in a room with a bathroom for a slightly lower cost since I was travelling with my underage niece. He is a very nice person. Denise, the night-shift receptionist, is also nice, friendly and polite. Very different from one of the morning-shift receptionists, the brunette one, who is extremelly unfriendly and impolite. The cleaning girls are also nice. The hotel is average. Bad points: internet access only at the lobby - which gets pretty crowded when many guests want to go online... - no breakfast (but it seems they're starting having it soon), the heating system is not very efficient, the stove in the kitchen on my floor was not working. Good points: Most os the staff is nice, the rooms are kind of small but comfortable (mattresses a little noisy...), cable tv, well located (near grocery stores, general stores, central park and subway station). Overall, a good hotel. Maybe the rates could be a little lower. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Why not!”
Reviews.Author: travelemz88
Reviews.Content: We were in New York for New Years eve so it was very pricey not matter where we went. If you want to email them a question... DONt Bother.. they never got back to me.. There was a big muddle up with my booking and it was very frustrating. There was a beautiful south African lady at reception. She upgraded us she was very approachable! as was the other lady! The men.. (im not sexist!) but dnt bother... they dont care about customers only about gtting a break to watch the telly!! Rooms- Dont expect clean just expect basic. (perfect for what we needed) Subway - Very close by.. Try get off on the 110th 1 line not the one further away... its a lil more dodgy. Location: OK not super safe but stay on the main roads u will be fine WALKING: It took us about 1 hr to wak into time square.. Straight down broadway. Breakfast-NOT INCLUDED Kitchen- Staff forgot to tell us there is full kitchen facilities on site!! All in all.. Its good for a budget travelller.. Wouldnt rave about it nor reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, quality worth of the money”
Reviews.Author: sonia2312
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, with underground stations close by. Plenty of eating places within walking distance. Room quality is not great. We opted for a double room. The bed was comfortable but the room was not very clean. The carpet was stained, bathroom not mopped and cleaned thoroughly everyday. I had dropped a few hairs on the bathroom floor and they stayed there for 4 days. Hotel quality can be improved. Staff is friendly and approachable.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: TheExBellman
Reviews.Content: Was already familiar with the neighborhood (as familiar as one can be with NYC after 4 years away), so I knew this was where I wanted to stay. Very limited lodging options in this neck of the woods, but I fully recommend it to get a true local experience. No sign out front in this quiet (again, relative), residential street. As others have noted, a safe area, but don't be careless. Clean and basic, felt like a dormitory almost. Myself and two buddies got a standard triple room with one full and one single bed. Tight quarters for 3 grown men, but it wasn't awful. Reasonable closet space, dresser, fridge, small tv hanging from the ceiling. Fresh towels and soap daily, beds made up. Did not have a private bath, but rarely had to wait to use the one on our floor. Kitchen wasn't really stocked with anything, but if you were staying a while and got your own stuff, it would really help. We just got some snacks from the West Side Market, a quintessentially New York local grocer. Grab the house special at the Hungarian Coffee Shop around the corner to start your day off right. Bedding is basic, but adequate. I can't imagine how some of these bed divas would have survived in earlier eras. The three of us thought they were fine. No noise issues. Easy access to the 1 train, which can get you just about anywhere. Unless you have physical limitations or deep pockets, don't bother with cabs. The system is easy to learn, cheap, reliable, quick, and provides great people-watching. Internet was only available in the little sitting area next to the front desk, but free and clear. I emailed the property with some questions a few days before going and never got a response. They may have been offended that I used the term 'hostel.' My bad. I think there was one other negative, but I forget what it was. I work in a 5-star joint, so I had to seriously adjust my expectations, but what I found was a great value in a great spot in NYC. With the same budget, it's where I'd stay again. Tip: don't ignore the local sites. The Cathedral of St. John the Divine is breathtaking, as is Riverside Church. Grant's Tomb, Harlem's main drag, the northern wilds of Central Park, and Columbia University are all walkable and worth the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for it's budget”
Reviews.Author: Erla B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one week and we loved it, Patrick was the best ! The staff is really nice and everyone really helpful. Recommend it if you wanna stay on Manhattan. Love to you guys from Iceland :)

Reviews.Title: “Value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer856
Reviews.Content: We chose the Morningside Inn for it’s upper west side location and value pricing. We reserved a superior 1 room which had an ensuite bath and a tv. The room was very small and Spartan, but that is to be expected for a budget hotel in New York. The room was clean and the bathroom had been updated. The elevator is small, but even though the hotel was full, we never had to wait very long. The worst part about our stay was the bed. It was very uncomfortable – you could feel every spring in the mattress. The pillows were also terrible. The tv was mounted next to the head of the bed, making it awkward to watch. The location was ideal for us. The subway is a few blocks away. The hotel is located between Amsterdam and Broadway. Both of these streets are lined with cafes, so there was an ample supply of reasonably priced dining options. The area felt very safe. We enjoyed getting bagels and coffee for breakfast at Absolute Bagels around the corner on Broadway. There is also a market that sells fresh fruit. This is a decent choice for budget travelers who just want a clean place to sleep after sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nor really cheap but really dirty”
Reviews.Author: Szilvia S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, the heart of Manhattan is only 30 minutes away by the underground. They don't serve food that wouldn't be a problem as in the advertisement they promised a shared kitchen that was nowhere around. I spent 4 nights there and they didn't even clean the room after the previous guest and there was no cleaning during my stay. There are a lot of cafes near the hotel and a small shop just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “alright for the money”
Reviews.Author: georginamg
Reviews.Content: This is clearly a budget hotel and lives up to that expectation. The furniture and the space in the room was the barely necessary, not an inch more or less. The corridors, carpets, paper-thin walls, tiny elevator... you just recognize the budget constraints everywhere. The service at the reception, same thing. The kitchen is absolutely basic, so you will just warm up a pizza in the microwave, period. The wifi works in some parts of the hotel only. However, the prices correspond to what you get. This is a place to sleep that will be clean and correct. You will have maps and some basic touristic info at the reception. No extras, no fuss, no luxury... just basic comfort in a good residential location near to many shops and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable price sleeping in NY”
Reviews.Author: WarsawExplorer
Reviews.Content: I spent there only one night. Clean, shared bathroom outside the room. In reality was dedicated to our room only while the second room was vacant. Good price and excellent location. Close to CP and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: flor_y_canto
Reviews.Content: I reserved a Superior One room with a private bath for two weeks. I arrived early and Patrick helped me store my luggage and graciously directed me to the local eateries. The room was clean, simple and straightforward. The bathroom was spotless and the refrigerator incredibly helpful as I was on a budget and needed to get groceries instead of eating out. Room was reliably cleaned daily. I attended the Columbia University Teacher's College Reading and Writing Project and walked to school everyday. The hotel is two buildings away from corner of Broadway and the metro and busses going to every part of the city were at most, three blocks away. Central Park is also within walking distance. The hotel is located on the 1 train route, so I could get downtown, midtown or to the LIncoln Center or Columbus Circle quickly and conveniently. All of the shops and restaurants on Broadway near hotel make it unnecessary to have to go somewhere else for a good meal or personal shopping. It seemed to me that most of the guests were budget travelers and gracious. In the end, I wish I would have had in-room WiFi, but that would have cost me more :). Their WiFi in common room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Eppi1954
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a budget triple for a week, and it was just right! I work for a housing department at a university, so I was quite wary of bed bugs. I read all the reviews of different hostels in NYC, and thought to take a chance on this one. Upon arrival, I planned to take my LED flashlight to the room before we all got in there with the bags. It's almost like the front desk staff read my mind because the first thing they asked was if I wanted to check out the room, and they handed me the key. I went up, searched with the flashlight, looked on the corners of the beds, removed all the linens, and saw no signs of bed bugs. They also cover their mattresses with bed bug resistant covers. The rooms were definitely small and worn, but the public bathrooms were kept clean as well as daily housekeeping to our rooms. I know they changed our linens each day because some days we had light blue sheets and other days we had white sheets :-). The front desk staff were friendly, it was a neat building, there was an elevator, and we felt safe. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space and close to metro”
Reviews.Author: Travelfun2011_0506
Reviews.Content: The Morningside Inn was a good place for our family to stay while seeing the NY sights - near the metro, a grocery store, and enough room for us to get a good night's sleep. Not a luxery suite, but very adquate for us.

Reviews.Title: “Bearable in an attractive part of New York”
Reviews.Author: davidh60
Reviews.Content: Budget spartan room with nothing moveable and unnecessary stern warning not to steal the furnishings. No TV, hence the bonus that there's no TV noise next door. Quiet street. Peaceful ambience inside, and the few guests seemed largely budget-conscious young travellers. Lifts and loos erratic. However, close by is Upper Broadway, a cheerful area with almost Parisian ambience, good eating, drinking and excellent bus/metro communications .

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and not that clean - but OK considering the price”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr33
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in May 2011, we booked a double bedroom with private bathroom. All in all it was OK for the price, but VERY basic and not that clean. Be warned : you MUST verify room before accepting it. We were given room 603 at first but we refused it : room was really tiny, bathroom really tiny as well, shower tap was dropping non stop, aircon had no button to switch it on or off! After refusing it, we were then given room 610, which was really larger (both room and bathroom) and aircon was working this time. Positive points : - Price : the only valuable reason to stay in this hotel : for 5 nights in a double bedroom with private bathroom, we paid only 700$ - Room : the 2nd one was quite large, including a closet, a fridge, a drawer, TV and a big bathroom. - TV : lots of TV channels Negative points : - Reception people incredibly unfriendly. I guess shouldn't expect more from a budget hotel in NY? - Be prepared for torn and unclean bathroom towels. They were changed everyday but never looked clean. - Floor was full of stains - Bed was VERY uncomfortable, we could feel the bedsprings on our backs - After 2 days we started scratching ourselves, so be warned if you are allergic! - TV was placed badly and we could hardly watch it from the bed - You can't open the windows!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel but good value”
Reviews.Author: JPC_11
Reviews.Content: Clean quiet and comfortable, all at a level reflected in the cost. Shared bathrooms were a minor problem. Room was bigger than expected.I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was OK”
Reviews.Author: kelbro1960
Reviews.Content: Very affordable hotel in great part of Manhatten. Wireless access was not in the room, but you have to go down into the basement which was a pain. Bathroom was very clean. There is no coffee maker in the room, but there is a fridge. I don't recommend this for a business stay, but if you don't care about amenities, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Minooka_Mary
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Morningside Inn - fixed up, painted up - unbelievable value for price, clean, safe and NO BEDBUGS !!! Good stay - very happy.

Reviews.Title: “don´t expect any luxury, worth the price”
Reviews.Author: darkcherryred
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for almost a week and I chose it because I was looking for a place in Manhattan with just relavitely cheap price, and bathroom inside the room, without having to go to Brooklyn or another area of NY. It was a good choice because it has an underground station very near so you can move around easily (it´s almost in the beginning of Harlem, very calm area). Ok forget staying in Manhattan visiting NY is a must (brooklyn or queens might be a good place I guess, and everybody knows much cheaper and with a wider range of places to choose from).. but I didn´t think so and it´s not easy to find a hotel in Manhattan with these features and not super expensive. Rooms were average, just basic, and we indeed had some problems with the hot water since some days it just didn´t work and they were a bit slow fixing it.. place was a bit noisy and things like that, but frankly being in NY you won´t spend much time inside the room so we were ok. I guess next time with a higher bidget I won´t come back here but for someone who can´t spend much and want to stay in Manhattan, it´s a good place, why not.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl347
Reviews.Content: This past December me and my two daughter's stayed at Morningside Inn on the upper west side of Manhattan. This made the 6th or 7th time we have stayed here. It is a great place if you are watching your pennies. It is a hostel, so no mints on your pillow, but it is very clean, safe and Patrick and his staff are wonderful. The neighborhood is very safe, and it has a lot of great restaurants within walking distance and is very close to Columbia University. Also it is only a couple of blocks from the Subway and less than a block from the bus. Would highly recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “basic comfort in budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomiam
Reviews.Content: hotel located near the Broadway Street, subway and Central Park. Quiet and safe neighborhood. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, towels changed every day. The bed was a little narrow. The bed had plastic cover under a sheet, which made it very noisy. Air conditioning was old and did not really cold down the room.

Reviews.Title: “For low budget really goood!”
Reviews.Author: Bennyss
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in this hotel and for this price in Manhattan it was really great! Room was a little old, bed was ok, not the newest one, but everything clean, fresh sheets, new towels every day, bin cleaned.. We had flat TV and frigde. Although no privat bathroom, there were 2 on the floor (about 4-5 rooms) and we had no problems in the moring (3 people). Bathroom gets little dirty and full of water after a while. Lokation was excellent, 3 minutes to the Subway then like 15 to times square, little grocery markets around the corner. We had a decent stay, if you don't want to spent lot of time in the hotel a relly cheap way to go to Mahattan. Would recomend for anyone that doesn't need much luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the value”
Reviews.Author: CPR007
Reviews.Content: As hotel rooms are generally very expensive in NY this seems to be a good alternative. It is cheap but do not expect a categorized hotel. Pros: - very good location, just 3 min walk to Metro station line 1, 110th street from there in 12min at times square - clean bath - bed was made every day - no cockroaches, no bedbugs Cons: - towel was within one week never changed (but I also did not asked)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: cusehoops11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at the beginning of December. Arrived at 2:30, which is a half hour after check-ins start. They tell me that my room isn't available! I had to wait 40 minutes for them to clean, which I'm sure just consisted of a quick vacuum. Once I entered the room, it was extremely cold. A huge draft of cold air came through both windows, and made the room unbearable when the HEAT wasn't working! YES, I was without heat the entire stay! Not to mention, I was also without hot water. Myself and many others complained about this and all management did was blame the customers for not making them aware?! They were made aware countless times and did nothing to remedy the situation, just said it was being fixed. My room was right next to their office so I had the pleasure of listening to everyone complaining about this every 5 minutes. This "hotel" is nothing but a glorified apartment. The main entrance looks nice, but once you look beyond it you'll see a building that is very old and hasn't been taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: midimanmac
Reviews.Content: My partner and i had been recommended this accommodation by a friend who visits new york on a regular basis. We arrived to be met by a friendly, helpfull receptionist. We had booked the hotel through their own website for $965 for 7 nights however we were then told that tax had to added to this bringing the total to $1105 which was unexpected. The room had two double beds, a large flat screen tv and fridge and was clean and tidy with en suite bathroom / shower. The accomodation is about three blocks away from the broadway at 110th street metro station. We bought a 7 day metro pass at $26 each, this is excellent value as it covered all our travel for the week including our train to JFK for our return flight as apposed to $80 for a taxi. There is a Bank of America on the corner we used to change our travellers cheques and a Irish bar called O connels around the corner we used regularly. We used a fantastic deli around the corner near to the 110th street metro called West side deli where we would buy salad bowls made up toour own choice which included various types of chicken which we would take out and about with us and also dif types of soup. The one down point about the accomodaton was that our room was on the lower floor near to the reception desk and we were woken daily by the latino staffs loud talking at 7am. Apart from this cant fault it

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: jjzazzy
Reviews.Content: Best price in Manhattan, 3 blocks from Subway line #1. Excellent location near Central Park, Columbia Univeristy, theater area. Very budget, no frills with shared bathroom. Better than dorms in a hostel. Clean linens, clean bathroom. Helpfull staff. Laundry available, close to shops. Ok safe neighbourhood for the experienced budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Close to The Subway”
Reviews.Author: Caiden
Reviews.Content: The Morningside Inn is a very good hotel. The rooms are clean. The hotel is really close to a subway, food outlets and is right next door to a Church. We all enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated the Morningside Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Charlene51
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed at the Morningside Inn for six days. It may not be in the middle of Times Square but is accessible to wherever you might want to go easily by the subway. The metro system is a couple of very short blocks from the hotel, and as you walk home there are three grocery stores in addition to a bakery. The grocery store on the corner was the one we used and had everything you would need down to a can opener. The hotel is in a very safe, quiet residential neighborhood. We never heard any noises inside or outside the hotel during any night of our stay. There were even signs that if you honk your horn you can be fined. Coming from the Sesame Street era, I felt Big Bird was going to step out at any moment as I looked down the street. In addition, we appreciated everyone who worked at the inn. They worked tirelessly to make our stay as pleasurable as possible. The cleaning staff was always busy, and the office staff was always available and very pleasant.. I might mention that Bobby was extra nice and Patrick, the manager, could not have been nicer or more helpful, in addition to his constant smiling face. It was as though we had always known him. He certainly is to be commended. If you want a safe place to stay that doesn't cost an arm and a leg so that you can afford to go to Broadway shows and do other expensive activities, The Morningside Inn is for you and your family. We don't spend much time in our room, and it was the least expensive place I could find for three people and we were able to save a bundle in an expensive city by having a small kitchen where I could cook. We plan to go back to NYC in the future and will definitely stay there along with recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine base”
Reviews.Author: angelcake375
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice, once in Dec 2004 for my 21st birthday and again in Dec 2006. I do consider myself to have high standards when it comes to hotels, restaurants etc but for somewhere like New York all you need is a base! You literally need somewhere to sleep and get ready in the mornings and this place caters for that perfectly. On my first stay me and my friend had a twin room with a shared bathroom, which, looking back I would probably not do again, however we had no issues getting in to use the bathroom and the room was adequate. Ok, so not all the furniture matches and there was a loud water pipe in the room but it didnt keep us awake, so going back to my original point-it was exactly what we needed. I dont see the point in wasting valuable spending money on accommadation in a place like new York! The second stay there were three of us and we stayed in the apartment suite on the ground floor at the end of the corridor. This consisted of a double bedroom, bathroom with bath and shower, living area with a bed settee and a kitchen area with fridge, freezer, sink and table. We also had a tv in the room and loved watching the American talk shows when were getting ready! Again, it wasnt exactly something out of the pages of an interior design magazine, however it was exactly what we needed. The location was great too, not too close to cramped midtown and not too far out that is was ever an issue to get about. The subway goes everywhere you need! Although the area is quite quiet, we never felt threatened at all. All in all both of my stays at the Morningside Inn were perfectly accectable for my needs. If you are wanting a base to explore new York and dont want to spend too much on a hotel but want somwhere clean and comfortable, the Morningside Inn will not disappoint you. Oh and hello to the manag er if you are reading this! He remembered us the second time we came and we had a few chats with him when we got in from nights out, hes great!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PucBuny
Reviews.Content: So My friends and I got into NYC early in the AM..we were told there was lockers to keep our stuff in so we could go and see some sights before we checked in....when we got there we had to go to the "B" and we get there and its a room with a lock on it to keep our stuff in..OK i guess...when we came back to check in we were suppose to have a Private bath,we were told the room was already taken and there was no other Private rooms with bath...so we had to stay in a room with shared bath,it wasnt that bad at all really minus the bathrooms were small and there was mold on the curtains in the shower,the bedrooms werent so bad small but not bad if your only sleeping in it which thats all we did..only time we spent in the room was to get changed between shows and go to bed....staff was very friendly and as for Patrick which alot of other ppl said he was rude and not friendly at all...we had no problem with him at all very very friendly and was very nice..i lost my $ in the machine in the lounge i went up to the desk and he was very willing to give it back to me..and he also called us a cab for he AM we were leaving..and the cab was there even be4 we were ready...I would say if your looking for some place just to sleep and not spending much time in the hotel and want something cheap this would be a good hotel..and its only a few blocks away from the subway also.And Pat your a really good guy..thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Like an Hotel in a third world war zone”
Reviews.Author: orbitter
Reviews.Content: At Morningside Inn, the idea of customer care is far below the imagined standard, infact they simple dont care about what you get. Today i was forced to have a cold shower because there was no hot water. I came down to report to the manager/man at the reception, but he was busy quarelling with one of the girl at the reception, I stood there for nearly 30 minutes! Morningside Inn is not what i can recommend to friends or any one.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ifapel
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is fantastic. Just a couple of blocks away from the subway, North Central Park and a supermarket. Safe, clean and quiet. The staff is very helpful. It only loses points because of the bathroom. It was a bit cold compared to the rest of the room. Other than that, great place. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Atrocious Service!”
Reviews.Author: BelmontWanderer
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOSTEL! I booked this dump of a hotel, that doubles as a hostel for longer-term stays on the side (probably illegally since they don't advertise it, you have to ask), for an extended stay this summer. Let's just say it was a terrible mistake, but a lesson learned! Some people in this world are just terrible people and not to be trusted. Students, do not stay here for its hostel services. Do not pay deposits to these unscrupulous people because I assure you, your integrity as a consumer will not be respected and you will not be satisfied! When I arrived, my room was not in the condition or for the price I agreed to over the phone when I paid my deposit. When the receptionist called the manager at my request, this "manager" started yelling at the receptionist over the phone, it was unbelievable! The next morning, not only was Patrick the manager completely unsympathetic to my legitimate claims, but used physical and verbal intimidation against me when I wanted to get back my deposit. As a manager of hotel, Patrick represents the worst unapologetic greed-driven, relentlessly angry, power-hungry sociopath who is in reality just a overglamorized slumlord. This type of man should not be running a hospitality business. I was so PO'ed by this service, I immediately left and found lodging in the city elsewhere, which is really not that hard to do. But, several hundreds dollars down the drain! And my one night's stay? Absolutely atrocious, I could not imagine living in those conditions for extended stay. The shared bathrooms were dirty and disgusting, the kitchen trash overflowing, bedroom furniture mismatched together, and overall architecture and atmosphere of the place resembled a 19th century tenement. I did not stay long enough to verify the many claims of bedbugs, but if it were true, that'll hardly surprise me. I'd thought to write this review as a public service for those traveling in 2010. 2 words: STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT PLAN TO STAY HERE !!!!”
Reviews.Author: runningman65
Reviews.Content: After much scrutiny on cost and standards, I decided to make a reservation for my 3 night stay in NYC at the Morningside Inn as it seemed a resonable balance between the two, despite some negative reviews. However on arrival I queued behind a couple trying to check in. I overheard that there on-line reservation was not received by the hotel, and thy had no rooms available. Back luck I thought. When I was greeted at the desk, I was informed that there was a problem with the room and they could not honour the reservation. So we faced the prospect of having to find alternative accomodation on a freezing NY night, at a time of year where xmas tourism is at its height. Fortunately ( if that is the right word ) - The West Side Inn was right next door. I remembered this place from my prior research, and had rejected it out of hand as it was widely regarded as a dump. However, they had rooms available - and for fear of being stranded decided to take them. To be fair to the place, it was a dump - but it was warm and resonable clean. It seems to me that Morningside Inn are accepting on line bookings to fill the rooms, but re-selling them at a higher rate if they have the opportunity. My advice, don't risk it. Stay away. They don't deserve yours or anyone elses business.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great !”
Reviews.Author: Indinin
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews here. But after researching extensively - I went with Morning Side for its Location. I spent over a week here and it was extremely comfortable! I rented a standard roon with pvt bath. This is a decent and clean place. Yes the rooms are small- but that’s Manhattan. The place is perfect if you are looking for a affordable yet comfortable & safe place to stay in Mahattan ( wh is super expensive) I did use a shared bath for one night and it was OK too! The staff and esp Pat is extremely hospitable. The location is very lively and safe which is great!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Traveller24Uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September and i have to say, after reading the reviews i was very apprehensive about staying here but was pleasently surprised when i arrived. I had booked a room for 4 people with a private bathroom. This is exaclty what we got... the room had 2 double beds and enough room to move around. It was like staying in a bed and breakfast, without the breakfast. The room was clean and had everything you would expect including a small fridge. The room was cleaned every day and we had clean towels provided each time the room was cleaned. The hostel is about a 3-4 minute walk from the subway and there are plenty of places to eat / drink around the area. All in all, for what we paid (and as it was only a place for us to sleep / get ready in) we were very happy. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone who is going to New York on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: marie_scott
Reviews.Content: my family and i reserved a room at morningside inn for 9 nights we booked a deluxe double with a private bathroom, the room was pretty clean the staff was friendly helped us book tours around the city. their is 24 hour service at the front desk which was a plus! our room was cleaned daily fresh sheets and towels the location was perfect just a 5 minute subway ride to 42 street time square and 7 blocks from Columbia University. we enjoyed our stay and hope to return pretty soon!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Yuk70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in early October 2009 and they have a serious bed bug problem. Numerous people were complaining about it so we have reason to believe it is in a number of rooms. Having arrived back home yesterday I have a huge number of really serious bites on me and the fun of now worrying that we have brought them back home in our luggage. Seriously, DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to confirm again and again with them!!!”
Reviews.Author: gadgt69
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in january and had an e-mail confirmation from them. My partner phoned them the day before we were due to travel just to make sure all was well and they had no record of the booking at all. Further to that the attitude of the person on the phone was pretty rude. She instructed us to e-mail the manager (apparently the only way to contact him) and he would e-mail us back within 5 minutes, it's a week later and i'm still waiting. Got another hotel (city park) that was only $30 a night more and was great and in a much better location

Reviews.Title: “Great value for New York City”
Reviews.Author: MLouNolan
Reviews.Content: I was hesitate about staying at a one star hotel but a friend had said it was fine. We were very pleased with what we got for $90 for the two of us. Our room was clean and attractive with enough room for a double bed and a twin bed with good storage (a closet and lots of drawers.) We appreciated the refrigerator in the room. Our bathroom was newly tiled and very clean and shiny. The only negative thing I would say was the hall carpets were worn looking and unattractive. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The neighborhood was quiet-a very residential apartment neighborhood. There were lots of grocery stores and decent and inexpensive restaurants nearby. For a little more exciting neighborhood, Columbia University was only about five blocks away. We are a couple in our 60's and felt comfortable here. It is advertised through a hostel site and I pictured it being full of young people. It was mixed as far as that went. If you don't have to have to have something fancy, I think you would be very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best budget-hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Bultrug
Reviews.Content: Mother, father and daughter stayed in the Morningside Inn twice: in july 4 nights in a room with shared bathroom, and again in august in a room with private bathroom. Staff was very, very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean, rooms had TV, AC, fan, fridge. Shared kitchenette with microwave was very handy. Excellent location near Broadway with everything you need, e.g. restaurants, banks, subway (don't miss the enourmous grocery/delicatesse around the corner!). You might think that the carpet in the hallway is a bit old, but then consider the price! It is everything I ask for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic budget hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Twilight89
Reviews.Content: me and my mum stayed here for 6 nights in nov 2008. after reading reviews on here i was abit apprehensive about staying here. so i thought i would ring the hotel myself and check that what i had actually booked was all in order, they assured me it was. when we arrived at the hotel, i did think well its not the ritz, but i hadn't paid that kind of money out.the hotel looked nice and what i would expect for upper manhattan. the staff were really nice and helpful, 24hour service also.PLUS they got our booking right. our room was very clean and warm and we had private bathroom. the room was cleaned every day and our bed made every day.also we had a tv in our room whcih was free. the hotel isnt central, but theres a metro stop just round the corner. we used it every day, its brilliant and very cheap. even though the hotel isnt central its not a problem theres loads of things near and it take 5-10mins on the metro to get to times square.(and we used the metro at night, we honestly felt safer there then we do here at night) all in all, this hotel is ideal!..why spends hundreds of pounds on a hotel that your only going to sleep and shower in.new york isnt a place you go to for the hotel, your hotel is your base thats all. we will be definatly staying here again next year. i recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a brilliant trip to new york and to see all of the city. and still have plenty of spending money

Reviews.Title: “Really incredible 'hotel'”
Reviews.Author: AlessandroIngrosso
Reviews.Content: Very very cheap hotel, but very very durty and...... We booked a room for three people and when we been there they gave us a room withg a spacious for max 1 person. As well the photos that they show in the web site are different comparte to the really room. they gave us another room, just after the main entrance, wich was not bud as a spacious but it was raining inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - Dishonest - Ripoff - DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: PPHILL
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms with single bed in each with PRIVATE bathrooms....... ... .what we got 1 room with a smaller than double bed. Shared bathroom that wasn't big enough to swing a cat. The manager is VERY cheeky and the staff don't have a clue. Chared us DOUBLE THE PRICE! - BUGS everywhere! I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy...its terrible. Basically, we turned up. Logged straight online. Booked a hotel up the road "Hotel Newton" Chucked the morningside keys behind reception (As no one was ever there) and had the best stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “rip off hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: juanogag
Reviews.Content: We got ripped off by this hotel. We booked and paid for a superior room with aircon but we are given a budget standard room without airconding. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing even with lowered expectations.”
Reviews.Author: MileHiFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: While we weren't expecting much due to the price, there were a number of issues. Complete and utter lack of professionalism demonstrated by the staff. In spite of several calls and an email, we could never get any written confirmation of our reservations, only verbal assurances that they would "make it work". Upon arrival, our reservations were wrong and the price was higher than advertised. When presented with an issue, the staff acts dumb and unsympathetic, and defers to Patrick the Manager, whom we never saw. Drab surroundings. There was nothing updated or convenient about the rooms in the hotel, although they advertise a recent renovation. The beds are very hard - so unless you enjoy sleeping on the floor, you will probably not enjoy sleeping on these beds. Noise. We were moved to a lesser room for our final night, which lacked an air conditioner, a private bath, or even a nightstand with lamp by the bed. The AC would have been good not just for comfortable temperature but to block the noise from the street (all night long) and the loud couple next door who talked loudly and slammed their door repeatedly late at night. Security. There are only little doorknob locks and no security locks on the inside of the room, and as a consequence, we had maids in the room banging on the bathroom door while showering. There are no 'do not disturb' signs. The front entrance never seems to be locked, so I'm not sure how guests really sleep at night. Cleanliness. The sheets and towels were clean. Everything else was kind of grubby. Shared bathrooms were not at all clean. There was garbage heaped high in the kitchen. I would not stay there again, primarily due to the unprofessional, unhelpful staff who added stress and wasted time to our modest vacation. If they had ever once demonstrated genuine concern before or during our stay, I would return again, packing a fluffy mattress pad and my own 'do not disturb' sign.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hostel!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertosB
Reviews.Content: This hostel is really great! Stayed here in 2006 for 6 months and came back in 2008 to stay here again for 2 weeks! I'm a student and you will meet international friends here before you know it, too play pool @ one of the many bars in the hostel's area! I know I will stay here in future again! Staff is unbelievable, keep up the good work guys! Albert, Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUG infested hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MeliEuropean
Reviews.Content: this hotel has bedbugs on every level.. staff is partly rude/disrespectful, partly nice. Cleanliness - not given. Parasites - aside the bedbugs a lot, roaches, mice, other bugs.. If you think you are having mosquito bites - that is not it. The bedbugs are invisible during the day. You d have to stay a couple of months to actually see one. Do yourself a favour search for a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Morningside Inn - a little gem”
Reviews.Author: Blightedplanet
Reviews.Content: The Morningside Inn has received such mixed reviews that we were pretty anxious about our week-long stay there. We needn't have worried. We arrived a day later than usual (due to Air India no longer using JFK) and late at night. Patrick meet us on arrival and told us that our original room had been let as the travel company hadn't informed him of new arrival date. He was very pleasant and helpful, putting us in an ensuite room (we'd originally booked a budget room with shared bath) telling us to get some sleep and relax and that the room situation would be sorted out the next morning. As it turned out we were allowed to remain in the room and no extra charge which was perfect. Okay, the Morningside isn't the poshest hotel in NY but it was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable and the room warm. We did experience a slight problem with hot water (which occasionally did not run more than warm in the early evening) but it was fine for showering. The Morningside is in an excellent location (great for subways and buses). The street was very pretty and extremely quiet at night. Pharmacies and delis, etc are very close at hand. Going to the Columbia Deli for breakfast was lovely. You get a real taste of genuine NY life - which you don't get if you stay near Times Square, say. We would definitely consider staying at the Morningside Inn again. Our experience was a wholly positive one and contributed to a truly fantastic holiday in NYC - an 18th birthday present for our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: erollmann1
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York City on business every year and I insist on staying at the Morningside Inn. The location just moments away from the 1 line, gives me quick access to all the great sites in New York, including Little Italy, Chinatown, Greenwich Village, Times Square and more. This hotel is very clean. The staff is great, especially Patrick, who is a pleasure to see every trip and is very courteous to guests. I always know my stay from arrival to departure is in good hands with Patrick. The front desk is staffed 24/7 and the nearby block has good restaurants, drug stores, fast food and shops to pick up anything I need at a moment's notice. There is a computer with internet access on sight to check up on e-mail or google street locations. The price to stay at the morningside is outstanding! It's hard to believe you can have such an inexpensive, yet quality stay in the Big Apple. I will continue to book each trip here and heartily recommend booking your next stay at the Morningside Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rabinoshka
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Morningside Inn hotel in New York! This was my first visit to the city, and I really didn't want a bad hotel to ruin everything for me. Well, I'm glad that I had made a wise choice! Morningside Inn is perfectly located - the area is clean, safe, has a lot of shops, banks, restaurants, etc. It's minutes away from the subway and you can easily get anywhere from there. The hotel itself was very quiet - no noisy parties, no drinking on the porch. The management was very helpful. The room was cleaned every day, and so were the bathroom facilities. There is an Internet room in the basement, that has a computer and free Wi-Fi access. In short, this hotel is highly recommended for everyone who travels on a budget but wishes to get the most out of his/her New York experience!!! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Experience- Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: insimi15
Reviews.Content: We had confirmed reservations for 3 nights but when we arrived, we were supposedly on a "waiting list". They accommodated us in not one but 2 separate rooms because the newly trained staff did not have the authority to have a roll-away bed put into our room for the 3rd person. We ended up paying $100 for each room. They made us check out the next morning so they could put us in one room, but then again made us check out and check back in the 3rd day. All this was very inconvenient especially when we had plans to tour the city. The nightmare began when we came back at 4:30pm the 3rd day to check back in. There were no rooms available, except for 2 rooms that were recently fumigated for an infestation of ants. We asked to view the rooms and decided the first room smelt too strongly of chemicals, but the second was tolerable. At the same time a couple from Philly was also being offered one of these 2 rooms as their confirmed reservation simply "didn't exist" in the Inn's system. Unfortunately for them we took the better of the two bad rooms, which cost us about $83, whereas the other room was offered to us at $50. I mentioned this to the couple who asked the manager if they could get the worse room for $50. The manager Pat flipped out and asked me why I did that and threatened to give my $83 back and kick us out of the Inn. He also said that he was trying to do us a favor and I was basically ungrateful. From the other reviews and my personal experience it seems like this manager Pat is a BIG BULLY. His behavior and policies are UNACCEPTABLE. In the end, I had to apologize just because I had no place else to go for my last night in NYC. This experience single handedly ruined my trip to NY. I would have rather paid more and be treated like a human being. Please stay away from Morningside Inn for you own good.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here all the time and "LOVE" it!!!”
Reviews.Author: KRowe
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC about 3 times every year and I always stay at the Morningside Inn. The Manager Patrick is very helpful & friendly. You couldn't ask for better! The hotel is clean & comfortable and the staff are friendly. For the price you pay,..this budget hotel is perfect. It's located in the nice Upper West Side and is close to subway routes, drugstores, markets, churches, bars and diners. I feel safe in this hotel and have never worried about my belongings being left in the room. The rooms I have stayed in are equipped with a color TV, sink, small fridge (great in the summer for your cold drinks), air conditioner, phone, desk, and I pay a little extra for a private bathroom. The linens are clean and the towels are replaced daily. I have told all my friends about this place,..and I will continue to stay here on each of my visits. This is a great place if you want to save some money on your hotel,..and spend more on the city sights. Kathy Rowe St. John's, Newfoundland, Canada

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rwearle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here every year when we go to New York on vacation, and we love it. The staff are friendly, it's located in a nice neighborhood with quick access to the subway (the 1 line), and we've never had a problem with cleanliness. We've stayed in more expensive hotels where we received less service. The pricing *is* budget conscious, so you have to realize that it's not the Ritz. But if you'd rather spend your money on seeing and enjoying New York City instead of on the room where, for the most part, you're only going to be sleeping anyways, you can't go wrong with the Morningside Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about staying there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lacobond
Reviews.Content: We paid on cash at the desk - DO NOT DO IT! When they wrongly gave us tiny room with only one bed (we were 2), personal even gave us one extra bed, but it should not change for upcoming 2 nights. Imagine, that after that, there was no space for luggage left in the room. After short sleep and morning bad experience in dirty community bathroom, we decided that we are leaving hotel and will not remain any other single night there. Till this point, personal was nice on us, and trying to help us. From this point, manager - Patric started yelling on us, that we have f**cked up HIS new year's eve!! ..that he has to come from his home to arrange the better room for us etc. First days Patric didn't want to refund us our money back (of course, with deduction per one night we stayed and one night cancelation fee - a standard policy). After I started argumenting with Customer Fraud office, he was willing to refund the money back. We were repeatedly told that credits would be processed and of course we travelled there every second day to pick up our money (money were comming, money were on way, Patric was travelling somewhere, money should be here next days etc) . We were lied 6-7 times about this and never got our money back!!! Even though we left there adress, email everything, there was no will to contact us! They've STOLEN our money! Patric is arogant and laying. If you try argue, you are told that you are not showing him respect and that you should shut up and let him talk. He was shouting on my girlfriend and that she should never talk with him, just me! If you are not will to meet all this stated above (and mentioned by many other reviewers), STAY AWAY!! Look for other hotel without bullying management.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: jeminlondon
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed in the Morningside Inn. We had originally booked a double room but had a friend who decided to accompany us. My husband emailed the given email address 4 times and did not receive a response, I then rang and spoke to Patrick, the manager, who agreed we could stay in a triple room and 'amended' our booking. When we arrived, we were told that we had to stay in one specific room overnight and to change the next day, by another staff member (not Patrick). After a 7 hour flight and 1 hour train ride into Manhattan, we were all looking forward to a hot shower, but as per the previous reviews, no hot water.... My husband made a complaint to the lady at the front desk and was told they were 'fixing the boiler' and it would be fine tomorrow. Needless to say, we did not have a proper shower until we got back to London. Next day, we try to check in to our new room only to be told by Patrick that he had no idea of the amendment to the booking and he had just rented his last triple room. When my husband explained his displeasure, stating that the receptionist on the previous day had confirmed that we would be staying in the same room, just on a different floor, he was told by Patrick that he had an 'attitude' and that we should all shut up and let him talk. He was very rude and arrogant. I would not recommend staying in this establishment unless you feel like being abused on your holiday. There are better hotels (with hot water and no bedbugs) for a little bit more money closer to the center of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: bosav
Reviews.Content: Hotel quality was above average/OK for the price class. But our stay was wonderful because of the general manager. Our luggage was lost and we arrived with nothing. My fiancé lost her important medical prescriptions along with the bags. We had a wedding to go to. The manager went out of his way to help us. He got a doctor willing to prescribe the medicines that were lost, right away, calling them to a drug store right around the corner. He helped us to figure out where to rent clothes inexpensively for the wedding, and he called the airlines several times to track the recovery and return of the bags. Bottom line – fairly decent place, fair price, good location, nice manager.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS stay away!”
Reviews.Author: melaniezacherl
Reviews.Content: I can confirm everything bad stated here. Bugs, noise, smell, mice in the kitchen and even in the rooms due to the large gap below the room's door. The aggressive manager threatening you when asking your money back. I studied in NYC (Columbia) and the uni had this hotel and Riverside Inn on the recommendation list. I was moved from Riverside when I complained bitterly about the bedbugs to this one. Not a bit better. I am sure no snob; I am still a student and used to cheap accomodation; content with little; liked the location and area a lot. I did NOT like the fact this hotel is infested with bedbugs (bloodsucking parasites in the materasses; you do not see them, they fear light and react to body warmth at night, check them out on wikipedia; unfortunately I learned many NY hostels and hotels have them). YOu think you have mosquito bites until you get to see one bedbug after a few weeks (so weekend tourists are likely to not realize the hotel has them - but are in danger of bringing them to their own homes within their textiles and suitcases - they re almost impossible to get rid of even with professional help - NY Times had them on their headline in fall 2005). I spent quite a few weeks in the hotel - believe me, you do not want to discover the bedbugs, mice in the rooms and kitchens, roaches, strange long-term residents, (really) dirty facilities, the poisonous smell in the rooms every time the exterminator visited (it suffocates you rather than the bugs).. Do yourself a favour and do not consider Riverside nor Morningside Inn (same owner and staff, same issues). I feel I have to share this here to spare others the bad experience I had there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: bikisdad
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the front door are the nicest parts of this "hotel." It is actually a dorm - which offers travelers rooms. Paper thin walls - so if you like privacy and want to sleep, forget it. We were there in the winter. My colleague had no heat. I had a space heater which kept blowing the circuits. We both had no hot water for 3 of the five days. Filthy halls. Sanitary bathroom, but too sanitary - had to air out each day because of the chlorine smell. Partying on Fridays - absolutely no sleep on weekends. Overnight "security" is no help - wouldn't do a thing. Manager charged the 5-nights we booked immediately upon our arrival (probably illegal). This gives him the upper edge - and we lost 2 nights lodging because we paid up-front (don't do this!!!! ). If you need a washcloth - you have to go down to the front desk to get it. If you insist that one is brought up - the person bringing it will scowl at you. The partying was the worst - we were in NY on business and wanted a place close to Columbia U - which this place is. We dreaded spending another night - so we asked the manager for 2-nights refund. We were repeatedly told that credits would be processed. We were lied to 4 times about this. If you want a refund forget it. We moved to a Days Hotel just down Broadway which was 10,000 times better and less expensive per night!!!! But the manger stuck us with 2 nights - which we are still trying to get by filing a dispute with our credit card companies.

Reviews.Title: “Smell of smoke”
Reviews.Author: Monik79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and me stayed at the Morningside Inn on December 2007. I didn't like it! In our room there was a terrible and a lingering smell of smoke. It was quite small and not so clean. I'll never come back there!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: afe
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay at this hotel. I was verbally abused by the manager, Patrick, who is a bully and a terrible hotel manager. When I spoke to him he became angry very quickly and at one stage he rose to his feet and threatened me. I suspect that he either has mental problems or is just very screwed up. Nobody has ever spoken to me that, never mind a hotel manager who is supposed to be serving you. This all happened on Christmas morning which almost ruined my Christmas day and my experience of New York. At the time I wondered whether I had made some cultural faux pas, but after reading other reviews I realise now that he was looking for an excuse to get into a fight and abuse somebody so that he could feel superior. I am actually quite concerned for anybody who stays here that they may be physically attacked if they say the wrong thing. The hotel itself was nothing special and not worth the extra money we paid. Our first room had wet carpet, smelt bad, and the heater hissed so loud we couldn't hear the television. Furthermore, we had paid extra for the 'superior' room (our Christmas treat) but this was clearly not the best room in the house as we soon discovered. The manager agreed to give us another room the next night, but made us feel like he was doing us a favour every time we spoke to him. We also had problems with the internet, however when I tried to speak to the manager he became extremely angry and insolent. I would highly recommend you steer clear of this hotel and I am surprised that this manager is still working here after my own experience and reading all these reports of people being abused. After the incident I felt extremely upset and also powerless since there is nobody to complain to.

Reviews.Title: “OK place, but not trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: jon_k84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Morningside Inn for five months while doing an internship in New York. The hotel in itself is not bad for the price, the rooms are ok and it’s not too far from central Manhattan. The night staff are nice and friendly. However, I had problems with the daily manager: The first incident happened when I was overcharged by $ 1,013 for my rent, two months before it was due – which is a big deal on a student budget. At first I thought it was a mistake, and when I pointed it out I was told the money would be refunded soon. However, after two weeks it still hadn’t been refunded. When I raised the issue again, the manager flipped completely. He said he had never told me it would be refunded and that it was money that was owed to the hotel. I tried to keep the conversation calm, but he quickly got completely furious and stood up and literally screamed in my face in front of other guests. I have never experienced anything like it, and was forced to just walk away even though I was obviously charged too much, too soon. The second incident happened when I tried to have my boyfriend stay overnight as my guest. The morning after the manager again got very angry and nasty because I was apparently not allowed to have overnight guests. Which is ok in itself, but the manner in which he was acting was very hostile. He said he would have my friend thrown in jail for trespassing even though I had clearly stated that he was my visitor. Ever since these incidents the manager had a very angry attitude, gave me hateful looks and made the whole atmosphere pretty uncomfortable. I don’t know if this aggressiveness was caused by me pointing out that I was charged too much and too soon, or the fact that I’m gay, or a combination of both. Either way it put a definite damper on my experience of New York City. I did hear him having loud arguments with guests on other occasions also, due to missing reservations and overcharging. For short stays, Morningside is ok as long as you don’t have a disagreement with the manager. For longer stays I would recommend looking somewhere else, or alternatively paying in cash (you don’t get a contract.) When I left I was promised I would be refunded for 5 extra nights I had been wrongfully charged for. I still haven't been, though.

Reviews.Title: “If you like horror stories, this is the place...”
Reviews.Author: KeeperoftheBridge
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to start about the Morningside – there’s nothing nice about it. Immediately upon our arrival, we were subject to rude customer service by the entire hotel staff, including Patrick, the hotel “manager” who claimed that we’d canceled our reservation, even though we had CONFIRMED our reservation the night before and had the documents to prove it. After acting like he did us a big favor, he gave us Room #604. What we found were several deficiencies of very basic amenities, from no batteries in the smoke detector to a chain lock that we could simply pull right off the wall to thin, dirty towels. This is in addition to no hot water in the shower and a heating system that turned on once every 12 hours (we slept in our jackets). Mismatched paint on the walls and bird feces inside the windowsill just added to the ambiance within the room. To top off our stay, Patrick again became inexplicably irate after we calmly asked him on our way out the door for the name of the property owner. He then proceeded to follow us out the front door to our waiting cab and physically assaulted me. When the police arrived, 2 eyewitnesses came forward to corroborate the fact that Patrick had smashed my face into the car door. I later required medical attention. It was a long weekend of horror stories at this place, finalized by being assaulted by Patrick. If you are thinking of staying here anytime soon, THINK AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “good secret”
Reviews.Author: jsohmer
Reviews.Content: Afraid of mixed reviews I still took a chance . I was especially worried they would not hold the room as I was arriving late . Marlene at the desk reassured me when I called. The room was clean, warm , and the little bathroom ample and cute. A lamp did not work but big deal The area.. really nice . Good restos around the corner and even a subway. For the price and area.. a great secret.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service at the Morningside Inn”
Reviews.Author: dgupman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Morningside Inn in New York City and was absolutely impressed with the staff and the accommodations for such a facility that was not known to me. I was especially impressed with the Managers ability to get me a room on such short notice and have his staff get it ready. I believe his name is Patrick. A great job for a facility not well known.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal In NYC”
Reviews.Author: Emooree
Reviews.Content: I stay in NYC a couple of weekends each month, and I have stayed in many different places. Now when I come into NYC I stay at the Morningside Inn exclusively. Comfortable, affordable and adorable, the Inn is located on the gorgeous Upper West Side next to a beautiful Cathedral. The staff, which allows 24 hour check-in, is so friendly and helpful. The owner/operator Patrick has been extremely helpful and accommodating when it comes to booking my stay, but I have also had no trouble booking online. The price can't be beat. They have an accommodation for any traveler's budget. I really recommend this great little Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveler04
Reviews.Content: While we were not expecting deluxe accommodations, for $130 per night, we did expect a safe, comfortable room. Unfortunately, loosing our reservations was just the tip of the iceberg.The manager, Patrick, acted like he was doing us a favor to find us a room. His behavior was rude and disrespectful, telling me to leave him alone so he could get his work done. The spartan furnishings were tolerable, but many other shortcomings were unacceptable: the doors to the room barely latched; the smoke detector had no batteries; the blankets were lightweight and there was no heat to turn on; tepid water arrived only after leaving the water running for 20 minutes. Both my daughter and I were charged for the same room and the refund I was promised "the next day" was not forthcoming by the time we checked out 3 days later. When asked for the contact information of the owners to file a complaint, the manager, Patrick, lost his temper and physically attacked a member of our party as we were trying to leave. Definitely not a safe place with the current management!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: fay7
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever seen: shabby, the people who are working there are totally unreliable and incompetent !!! Even though our room (with private bath) was confirmed by the owner himself, we were given another room (with shared bath) for the night. The next day we were supposed to move to our booked room and stored our luggage in the storage room. When we returned the same evening, they just stared at us and said: "We didn't think you'd come back so we gave your room to somebody else". And all this time our bags were in the storage room and they knew it !!! That' no way to treat anybody, especially not with a small child !

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean affordable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeous1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic trip of New York City. My first stay was at a hotel from hell on 106th Street before my sister introduced me to the Morningside Inn hotel on the Upper West Side. My nearly 3 week stay there was a breath of fresh air compared to the previous hotel. It was clean, quiet the staff was efficient and friendly and the manager is an absolute gem of a person. There was a phone and fridge in each room and a kitchen, fitted with a stove, microwave and cupboards on each floor. The common bathroom was shared by four rooms but that was ok as i never had to wait. The room had window AC which was a bit loud but bearable and the window in the room couldn't open. The location is excellent as it's within walking distance to restaurants, a supermarket, pharmacy, banks, fruit & veg markets, the subway and even a very good jazz bar. There's also some small theatres close by where you can watch live theatre. I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it for the budget conscious traveller looking for good, clean affordable accommodation close to all the major attractions but in a nice quiet area. Also good value for money for long-term stays as the rates are very reasonable. For an unrated hotel i give it two thumbs up. Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: Amir-Ali
Reviews.Content: Don't go there. The manager is very rude and disrespectful who doesn't care about his customers. After the first night we complained about the condition of our room that sheets were not cleaned, bathrooms are horrible and rooms smells really bad. In answer manager start cussing for five minutes with F words. We decided to leave the hotel because of his attitude. Long story short we left the hotel in the morning and he charged us for that night and I'm still working with my credit card company to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: “clean, no frills and affordable”
Reviews.Author: towkay_ming
Reviews.Content: ABOUT US: My gf and me (both of us are from Singapore). I'm 35, she's 29. We are budgeted travellers who just need a clean and quiet place to sleep. After the mixed reviews, we decided to go with the inn based on the budget and location to the subway. We stayed in morningside inn on oct 9th to the 12th. Arrving with an open mind and preparing for the worse, the "notorious" front office was noticibly plain but clean. The young girl working there was nonchalant, but quick to check me in. I paid cash to prevent any future discrepancies. (Although, be mindful that the young girl do not have access to the cashier after office hours, so pls bring exact change! ) So far so good. Now the room... I booked a double room with shared showers. The room is really plain but clean. A bed which was made up everyday, a fan with a hanging light, a window which worked. No aircon or heater, but it was autum now, so fresh air suited us fine. I was pleasantly surpised when i found out that there was a sink, a fridge and a phone in the room. The common shower is shared between 2 to 3 rooms each. Wasn't an issue. Most guests there usually have different agendas so no need to wait at all. The location and neighbourhood was quite good. Supermarkets are 3 to 5mins mins away. Eateries are nearby too. Both Absolut Bagels on 107th and Tom's Restaurant (112th), made famous by Seinfeld, are good for breakfast. Subway to downtown is only 5 mins away. One thing I noticed was the inexperienced front office. Other than the big man himself who is present only in the morning, the rest of the young staff seemed clueless about the hotel. I was given 3 keys to my room, and the young girl couldn't tell me what the other 2 keys were for. Another girl couldnt' tell me the rates of making a local call in the room. That didn't bother me too much since my criteria was more cleanliess and location. So overall, Morningside Inn fitted our criteria and I won't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: andre6
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, comfortable, and nice staff. I'd recommend getting a room with private bath. Relatively quiet, but I'd recommend earplugs if you are sensitive to noise. Hotels in NYC are expensive, and this place is a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “You may get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LeonT
Reviews.Content: Pros: quiet location; very clean room, affordable rates, ceiling fan, air conditioner and room fridge. Cons: no towel racks, no toilet roll holder, poorly installed security chain on door, no peep-hole, broken telephone, no closet or hangers in my room. Ceiling fan only works with the light 'on'. Poor hospitality staff. I booked one month in advance, on-line, for two nights. When I checked in they said only for one night. Twenty minutes later, they found me a room for two nights. It had no bathroom and was not what I reserved on-line. Twenty more minutes later, they found me a room for two nights with a bathroom. It had no closet [see cons above]. I was also required to pay the "upgrade" to the superior room. But it was Morningside's mistake. In conclusion, this is a clean place and reasonably cheap, but it's not a polished hotel in the tradition of hospitality. For instance, if a hotel makes a mistake regarding your reservation, they never make the customer pay the difference in price. But Morningside isn't run by professionals. It's run by one friendly man and his inexperienced staff. The renovation continues and the work is sloppy at best. My friend was staying in room 101 and they installed carpet on the second day of his week there!! Nobody is taking the right amount of care to finish the hotel before somebody stays there. So, if you decide to stay, don't get room 604 until the items I have listed are fixed. At $150 per night, they should have done better. I may not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised”
Reviews.Author: donal_1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4nights a few weeks back with my girlfriend. We booked it without reading reviews, and after reading them i was worried as to what we were letting ourselves in for. However we couldnt have asked for more from the place. Good location, clean room and we found the staff very nice and helpful. People if your getting a good price on the room you have to realise your not going to get anything that is worthy for a king and queen. If you are going to new york for a few days your not even going to be in the room for more than 12hrs a day anyways. Get out and enjoy the place!

Reviews.Title: “"Superb Staff - Great Neighbourhood"”
Reviews.Author: Jaineen
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was polite and gracious! We continue to visit this hotel because of its cozy location (just blocks away from a train station) and the rooms with kitchenettes which saves us tons of cash. No complaints here! Perfect for budget traveler needs.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL EXPERIENCE! Almost ended up on New York's sidewalks...”
Reviews.Author: dmq2377
Reviews.Content: TOURISTS BEWARE!!! I'm a young graduate relocating to NY, I had to find a decent accommodation near the university facilities and Moningside Inn looked like something "value for money", but still acceptable...I wasn't expecting anything immaculate, I knew it wouldn't be the Rizt...but I wasn't expecting what was around the corner either: we booked well in advance, well aware of the fact that NY is crowded and everybody wants something cheap but in the city centre...I had my booking confirmation and everything was cool until I got there: they told me they never got my booking, then they told me that instead of 7 days they had a 3 days booking. For the rest 4 days no rooms. No place to stay. I contacted the agency I booked the rooms with, they confirmed my booking...they told me to speak with the manager, but he was nowhere to be found...For the first day of my stay AND the second day...then I got worried: one last day and then I would have been with no room. So on the third day - no manager in sight - I went and looked for a cheap alternative (very hard on a budget, and on such short notice). Evetually I found a good place, not as cheap. When I went back...voilà, the manager was back (apparently after a nasty call from the broker I booked the room with), and insted of APOLOGISING ON BEHALF OF THE HOSTEL, NO!!!HE BECAME ALL DEFENSIVE, AND STARTED ARGUING, saying I should not book anywhere else (even if his coworkers told me there was no booking for me and no available room for the next days)... Can u believe this??? Also, the broker got 10% on seven night, but eventually I was in the Morningside Inn for a shorter period of time...any chance to get my money back? what do u think?Any guess? What kind of service is that? NO SERVICE, NO RESPECT FOR PEOPLE, IS JUST A MONEY MAKING MACHINE, INNIT? Very good for my first 3 days in NYC...I suppose....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable in nice are with close subway”
Reviews.Author: Frandrake
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a budget accomodation for 10 days in NYC and I wanted private bathroom. I managed to find this accomodation at Morningside Inn, in a Superior room. The room was small and the bathroom even smaller, but everything was clean and cleaned up every day at no additional cost. All the appliances worked properly (air conditioning, tv, etc.) as well as the bathroom which was ok. I was a little disappointed when I knew that you have to pay per use to access wi-fi internet (4 bucks per 4 hours, 10 for 24 hours and so on). The surroundings are nice. There are a lot of shops in the area and the subway it's a 5-7 minutes walk. The overall impression is very good. It's not a luxury accomodation, but it is clean, reasonably priced, rich of services, safe and comfortable. I'd definetly go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Mpls
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this for a while. I stayed last October for a week and am not sure I'd stay again. I'm a single woman, middle-aged, fairly well traveled. Don't need luxury, just a clean room & a little service when required. I had the room on the first floor at the front, right on the street. It's a huge room by NYC standards but a bit grungy. The window air conditioner had substantial gaps between the expander panels and the window frame so I asked immediately if something could be done about it. Turns out I had to ask twice a day for the first three days I was there. As a single traveler, this seemed a safety issue even though the staff somewhat dismissed my concerns that it wouldn't be possible for someone to get in thru the window because it was too far from the sidewalk. That may be, but I don't like taking chances or paying to do so. The bed was comfortable & looked new but the sheets weren't changed even once during my week's stay. I"m not even sure if the cleaning staff made it in my room becuase there was a wrapper from a previous occupant that was never removed from the floor. (I left it there as a little test.) The last day I requested that the desk staff call a cab to take me to the airport. I had just enough money for the cab & some airport food but they instead called a car service that cost me quite a bit more. I had barely enough to cover the ride & ended up with almost no tip for the poor driver. I won't make that mistake again. So for a clean cheap room in NYC, it was OK but really nothing more. Oh and I'm really glad I had my earplugs with me -- the springs on the doors are really tight & the other guests always seemed to let the doors slam as loudly as possible at all hours of the night. Lastly, I find it really interesting that whenever a very negative review appears for this hotel, the management's response is inevitably to insult and blame the customer. Not the best way to make amends, I'd say.
