Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CathiSmith
Reviews.Content: I have meaning to write this review since our (my husband's and my) 5 day stay at the Morningside this last September. Not only was the price phenomenal for the area, but the room was actually very comfortable. And close to everything! There are a number of bus and train stops within a few blocks. The best part was that we used the bus to get there from the airport (JFK). It was so close it was like having our own shuttle! The staff was very, very nice, without being intrusive. I do not know why anyone would not like this place. Granted it is not a luxury hotel, but why travel to New York to stay in your room? We are used to camping, so our expectations may be a lot different from others. If you want luxury, you have to pay for it. I want value, cleanliness, safety, and proximity to the city; Morningside is all of the above and more. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlyLikeAByrd
Reviews.Content: When arriving to MORNINGSIDE INN I was greeted by a lovely young lady by the name of MARGARITA. she was very professional, kind, and helpful she even gave a us a list of great hang out & dining spots in the area and gave us directions around town, that alone assured me that my stay here would be great. You really get what you pay for I only stood for 5 nights but i would've definately stayed longer, the air conditioned rooms are comfortable, clean, and spacious. Coming to New York you usually worry about how expensive and how rude people can be but here i got great prices and service. ****NOW THATS A BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!!!!****

Reviews.Title: “nothing like the picture”
Reviews.Author: NCANOW
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel online..The picture looked great..We had plans in the neighboodhood so the location was great..The outside of the building looks great..Elevator a little shabby but wanted to give it a chance..We had reserved a Superior room..Was given a price of $117 a night..We were charged $130 a night..Hall rug very old and tattered..Room was very small..Too small for a closet so they put a metaql one in it..The frige is plugged into an extension cord..Had to plug in the tv and the oly place is the extension cord with the frige..No chair..No lamp..Bed is ankle high..No headboard..No matress pad..Just a sheet on a very thin mattress..Very noisey bed ..Every time you moved it woke you up..Wanted to set the clock radio to wake us ..Wasn't plugged in..Couldn't plug it in..,It was attached to dresser and cord wouldn't reach extension cord with tv and frige..That was the only outlet in the room...So we decided to call for a wake up call..had to plug in the phone ..After we hung up the phone kept buzzing..Called front desk..They said to dial 3 because we had a message..Dialed 3, no message..Phone kept buzzing..Front desk said to unplug it and they would knock on our door to wake us..No towel bars in bathroom..No hooks or hangers of any kind..No counter space in bathroom..Tiny towels felt like a loofah..No saftey bolt or lock on the door..Had to squeeze by each other to get around...If you like roughing it this is the place for you..But seriously there is no smoke alarm in the room either

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable price/quality”
Reviews.Author: WimLeuven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights this month on a city trip. As everybody here we booked the room to save some money to visit the city, its expensive enough. Loved the clean room on arrival, the quiet street between two busy ones (Broadway and Amsterdam), the fridge in the room, the a/c and fan , the cable tv. The bed was a bit small for two adults, the bathroom also, but not to bad overall. Disliked the quality of cleaning during our stay and the late check inn (4 pm) and early check out (11 am), even if you mail you arrive in the afternoon (we did at 3.30 pm after traveling 14 hours and with a six hours time difference) there was nothing to do about it : wait till 4 pm !! Also strange : pay all 8 nights before you even are allowed to check the room. In general : its for NYC a pretty good deal for your money, but its on the limit of accetable price/quality balance. Anyway no real complaints so for travellers who are aware of the price and what you can expect for it, its certainly a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: lmpaddock
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC for four nights and did not want to spend the fortune that most hotels cost here. The Morningside Inn is a part hostel/part hotel. I requested the Double Deluxe Room and it was really nice for what we paid for it, very affordable. Our room was behind the office right as you enter the building, which was odd, but the room had two double comfortable beds and a fairly spacious bathroom. The window air conditioner works great and kept the room very cool at all times. Also has two dressers and a closet for clothes, plus a mounted tv in the corner of the room. The only problem I had was that the shower water was luke warm at BEST and the shower leaked very slowly onto the carpet right in front of the bathroom. I never saw anything in the hotel besides the entryway, front desk, and our room. This hotel is a bit north of the heart of NYC (it is located on 107th and Broadway), but that doesn't matter at all. The subway at 103rd and Broadway is easily accessible and can take you anywhere! There are great restaurants, shops, flower stands, etc. nearby everywhere! I would definitely recommend this hotel for people who are trying to save money to spend elsewhere in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “bad news”
Reviews.Author: wootie74
Reviews.Content: As a bargain basement kind of hotel, this place would be tolerable if they would just change a few things: 1) give me a wastebasket in my room; 2) put a roll of toilet paper in the shared bath so I don't have to drag one in every time I need to use the facilities; 3) give me a hook and a rack in the bathroom where I can put my clothes and my towel; 4) fix the shower faucets so they don't fall off when I turn them on; 5) put something on the bottom of the tub so I don't slip immediately upon stepping into it; 6) fix the world' s worst caulking job in the showers. These are all small things - not expensive to fix, but they make life easier. And when they're not there - we notice. I could complain about other things - the hotel's dinginess, smelliness, etc., but I was prepared for that going in, despite the pretty pictures on their website. It just looks like they generally don't care and are cynically trying to squeeze every last dime out of that place that they can, because they're dealing (mostly) with a clientele that has few options at the hotel's price point. Me, I'm just a cheap guy who's always looking for a bargain. Maybe somewhere there's a halfway decent hotel in NYC for around $100. But this ain't it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Horrors”
Reviews.Author: KokaKola
Reviews.Content: Actually this hotel is a dump. The unskilled personnel will not do anything without asking "THE MANAGER" first. This manager had with a mocking humor slightly on the edge. I was afraid of him instantly. He promised us Internet would be installed in the following days. None of his staff knew even a computer existed in the house. The TV-room resembled a cell in an airless cellar only accessible by an old elevator. To change the channel you had to ask the staff upstairs at the reception, cos only they could change it. The"newly renovated hotel" is still in a state of renovation. Especially in the common zone. There is a strange smell in the room and no way to open the window, because of air-condition. The toilets are dirty and often clogged. The "Manager" charged us the booking fees explaining to us, that we should have taken a closer look at the website where we had booked. Never go there---I recommend the "Wanderer's Inn" hostel, it has breakfast, very nice and helpful staff, a tv in the double-bed room, it's clean and cheap. All the standards the "MANAGER" said "aint happenin' in New York City". Not in his hotel, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay, good service & location.”
Reviews.Author: justarover
Reviews.Content: We went to New York with six people and I was dreading the cost as we were somewhat on a budget and in NY, your dollar doesn't stretch that far. I booked the Morningside Inn as a compromise and was glad that I did. The location is good, easy for the subway (four blocks walk down to 103rd street - we always took breakfast on the way from one of the decent, cheap restaurants there) and subway is about quarter of an hour into Time Sq. Didn't entirely feel comfortable with the area late at night but you could easily have caught a cab back as its not far out of the city. Tick for location. When we turned up, the manager was unable to satisfy the booking as the internet had only shown my booking as one room not two. Not a problem - the manager sorted out extra beds for the room. While this mmigth not satisfy everyone, we were happy as the rooms were bigger than anything else that I had seen. all our requests (extra towels etc) were met with a smile and staff overall were helpful and happy. I ordered tickets off ebay and they were delivered and held by the fornt desk and given to me without even asking (I had forgotten!!) Rooms were clean and warm (it was five degrees at the time in NYC!!! In April!!) and everything seemed to work. Beds were comfortable and while its no luxury location, it provides good, clean accommodation at a sensible price. I was happy and would happily return. By the way party of six was two girls, four blokes and we ordered a four person suite and a superior room with en suite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend their money or more important things in new York but that still want a nice, clean room to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nokietta
Reviews.Content: It is just an hostel, but I really liked it. We stayed in a superior room, with a private bath. The room was tidy, and it is really closed to the underground. If u want a cheap but tidy place to stay in Ny, go there!

Reviews.Title: “great for budget”
Reviews.Author: newyorkisgreat
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hostel over the new year and can have no real complaints.we were 3 lads just after a place to sleep that was clean and tidy which it was....it was 3 blocks from the subway station and was in a decent area with diners and a bar nearby..just to get us started!! I agree that its hard to get the hot water flowing right in the shower but once you get the hang of it its ok!!! also towels changed daily,bins emptied and sheets changed. Dont come here expecting the hilton.....for $100 a night for 3 we thought it was great value and it left us more money to spend on the important things you dont go away to spend time in your room do you?!!! if you do stay here get the 7 day subway pass its only $24 and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Spooky but clean”
Reviews.Author: Bodysaba
Reviews.Content: I was a liitle bit worried about all the reviews that i read in advance but the price was unbeatable and it was only for 2 nights and i was looking for something in that area for Xmas eve. And the lobby of the hotel is nice and it's brand new but the rest of the corridors, scary lift and almost unlocked doors of the rooms need a quick change. Anyway, the room was accurate for 2 people and pretty clean. The room has got TV, refrigerator and it's ok. The furniture don't match at all (some of the them are made of metal, like in an office) but the bed was confortable and clean. There were some scary cables on the floor but we hid them behind the fridge. So, it worths a cheap price and you must know where you're going. It's not bad at all and i do not think it's dangerous or risky. No bugs, no rats, as i read. It's just a place to sleep but do not go there for a romantic weekend. The staff was friendly and, in case i would not find something better, i would not refuse to come back again for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Sanz
Reviews.Content: I'm an Australian female, single traveller who has just returned from eight weeks overseas. I stayed at Morningside Inn for about a week during October. The hotel did provide most of what it promised -- helpful staff who would call taxis for you and help you with directions for getting around the city, in particular -- a fridge and microwave in the room (without any utensils to back that up, though) and a laundromat nearby. I was disappointed mostly by the very uncomfortable bed, the poor quality sheets, the thin, tired pillow, and the single white towel (that was not replaced all week). To be fair, housemaids did find me another pillow and an extra cotton blanket with much ado following my request, but I ended up buying a blow-up pillow from the MoMA to supplement what was being offered. Perhaps the biggest disappointment of all was that I was in the US, the capital of worldwide television and advertising production, and there wasn't a TV in my room (or a joint TV room anywhere in the building) that I could switch on to get the news or some music. These are MUST have requirements when travelling alone. I went to the Radio Shack in the end and bought a portable, battery-operated radio to relieve the silence and compensate for the view of the brick wall outside (which I DID expect to find in NYC!). The internet was out of order for most of the week I was there. By the way, it was an antique anyway -- one of those coin-operated machines that you stand up and operate -- I hadn't seen such a machine anywhere in Australia for at least 10 years (yet the staff seemed to have all the latest equipment on their desk, including pay TV access). Upon checking out of the hotel, I suggested they may like to consider upgrading some of the technology, and at least providing it for single guests, rather than just stating it was available on their website. Sure, there are a couple of internet cafes nearby, but they would be better off promoting that Starbucks has wi-fi access worldwide so bring your own notebook! In the end, I bought a small notebook at a computer store, carried it round the world, and used wi-fi free at almost every destination (with the power adapters to suit each country that the computer salesman threw in). Overall, at least the Morningside Inn was a cheap place to shower and sleep, with staff that offered friendly advice for getting around the place, and if that's all you're looking for in New York and don't expect much more then the hotel is reasonably good value. One final suggestion for the management: a chair or two in the foyer wouldn't go astray so guests could wait inside while keeping an eye out for taxis, instead of having to stand outside on the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Ny!”
Reviews.Author: Honistoppenons
Reviews.Content: They were really super nice. Doing everything they can to help in every way. I never once had a problem there. Called cabs and willing to help with just about everything. I cant complain about anything other than i didnt find this place sooner. Thank you guys. You really made my trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “MISLEADING WEBSITE AND UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF!!”
Reviews.Author: Nyaccount
Reviews.Content: The information on the website is inaccurate: pictures are created by putting together pictures of beds and furniture!! Contrary to the website, there is no 24-hour service reception (desk closes at midnight), there is no security guard, no public or separate sitting areas - the only public space is in front of the Inn where lodgers talk until past midnight (front rooms very noisy as a result!!). The kitchen is not adequately equipped and the cleaning service is DISASTROUS: our sheets and towels were not changed for over 5 days, the trash was never emptied, while the floor carpet is worn out and spotted!! No need to mention that complaining to the staff is unnecessary as customer satisfaction seems to be their lowest priority... To conclude: it is a cheap place to stay, but the service and the attitude you get is still not worth paying such a price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the best of the three”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Morningside was the best of the three budget hotels I visited on a recent trip. The room was clean, fairly large, and had a very comfortable bed. It was also the only one with cable tv. I stayed at hotel 31, and hotel 17 as well ... and morningside offered a much nicer room. I had a private bath, so the only thing I can't rate is the shared bathroom. The location is good for access to Harlem and Central Park ... and you can get a subway to anywhere else. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They still your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The worst coustumer service ever. The manager Patrick, has a very bad attitude. I called to cancel my reservation and several days after he charged my credit card. I called to inquire about the issue and he told me "I would not help you, because I dont want to". Be aware they just still your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading both sides of the story, I must say that the stay this past weekend at Morningside was absolute wonderful. Patrick- front desk was the greatest with hotel assistance and suggestions for sight seeing and other places. Morningside Inn is a great for those travelers who just need it for one purpose "sleep".... especially with the hustling and bustling of shopping and sightseeing within a 24-48 hr duration. The location was perfect for taxi drives downtown and close walk to the central park. We drove from DC and found a parking spot on 107th a few feet away from the Morningside and use subways, taxi and good ole "pat & turn" walking. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hey ya'll! I actually stayed at Morningside Inn for a total of six months while I was attending school in NYC. I must say that at first I had my reservations about the place, but soon considered it home. Patrick (hotel manager) was amazing! He's super friendly and helpful when needed. I found the staff to also share the same friendliness. The only thing that was a little upsetting the whole time I was there was the fact that the phones were out of commission a lot. It became a little frustrating. But all in all, I felt completely safe there, no major problems with other attendents, great location and would recommend this place to anyone that wants to save money to spend on in that amazing city!

HotelInfo.Name: Morningside Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 235 West 107th Street, New York City, NY 10025
